item.title: A bill to provide for reimbursement of communities for purchases of supplies distributed to Katrina Survivors.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 206.

item.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 209.
Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

summary.text: Directs the President to reimburse a state or local government in which an emergency shelter for Hurricane Katrina survivors is operating for expenses incurred (such as overtime wages paid to police officers to ensure the provision of adequate coverage to portions of the state or locality other than the emergency shelter), regardless of whether the expenses were incurred for goods or services provided at the shelter's location.

bill.title: A bill to clarify which expenses relating to emergency shelters for Katrina Survivors are eligible for Federal reimbursement.

item.title: A bill to clarify which expenses relating to emergency shelters for Katrina Survivors are eligible for Federal reimbursement.
A bill to clarify which expenses relating to emergency shelters for Katrina Survivors are eligible for Federal reimbursement.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 209.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
